result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patty D Piersall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Patty D Piersall in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.

filed by Atty. Schmidt; independent presentence report on Ms. Piersall
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Patty D Piersall in court with attorney Dudley A. Williams.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Transcription of disc received from Court reporter.

Telephonic OWI Search Warrant Executed April 17, 2015
Disc
Preliminary hearing on May 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with her other pending case.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Patty D Piersall in court, in custody, with attorney Dudley A. Williams.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:15 am.
